page.title: 13GOVERNMENT IN WEST CAMBS.
page.content:
The parliamentary constituency of Huntingdon, to which the area belongs, is traditionally a safe Conservative seat; but in parish council elections personalities are more important than party politics.
Local government is in the control of Cambridgeshire County Council and Huntingdonshire District Council, but local matters are handled by the five parish councils of Catworth, Tilbrook, Spaldwick, Kimbolton and Stow Longa.
Amenities include a weekly refuse collection, except at Little Catworth, and mains sewerage throughout the area, apart from Stow Longa. Residents of Stow Longa enjoy the bonus of a fortnightly visit from the mobile library van.
